text: I love software, because if you can imagine something, you can build it.
author: Ray Ozzie

text: If you can read this, thank a Software Developer
author: Joseph M. Abou Nader

text: As a rule, software systems do not work well until they have been used, and have failed repeatedly, in real applications.
author: Dave Parnas

text: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: Anonymous

text: A SQL query walks into a bar. He approaches two tables and says, 'Mind if I join you?'
author: Anonymous

text: What we have to learn to do, we learn by doing.
author: Aristotle

text: The computers do what you tell them to do, not what you want them to do.
author: Alexander Atanasov

text: Prototyping will reduce development time & cost by 40%.
author: Larry Bernstein

text: Documentation is like sex; when it's good, it's very, very good, and when it's bad, it's better than nothing.
author: Dick Brandon

text: The only way to stop bugs is to kill the tester.
author: Assaad Chalhoub

text: When I wrote this, only God and I understood what I was doing. Now, God only knows
author: Anonymous

text: The details are details. They make the product.
author: Charles Eames

text: When you feel the need to write a comment, first try to refactor the code so that any comment becomes superflouus.
author: Martin Fowler

text: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: Martin Golding
